trans-unit.source: What is Microsoft Advanced Threat Analytics (ATA)?
trans-unit.target: What is Microsoft Advanced Threat Analytics (ATA)?

trans-unit.source: Explains what Microsoft Advanced Threat Analytics (ATA) is and what kinds of suspicious activities it can detect
trans-unit.target: Explains what Microsoft Advanced Threat Analytics (ATA) is and what kinds of suspicious activities it can detect

trans-unit.source: Advanced Threat Analytics (ATA) is an on-premises platform that helps protect your enterprise from multiple types of advanced targeted cyber attacks and insider threats.
trans-unit.target: Advanced Threat Analytics (ATA) is an on-premises platform that helps protect your enterprise from multiple types of advanced targeted cyber attacks and insider threats.

trans-unit.source: ATA takes information from multiple data-sources from logs and events in your network to learn the behavior of users and other entities in the organization and build a behavioral profile about them.
trans-unit.target: ATA takes information from multiple data-sources from logs and events in your network to learn the behavior of users and other entities in the organization and build a behavioral profile about them.

trans-unit.source: ATA can receive events and logs from:
trans-unit.target: ATA can receive events and logs from:

trans-unit.source: In addition, ATA leverages a proprietary network parsing engine to capture and parse network traffic of multiple protocols (such as Kerberos, DNS, RPC, NTLM and others) for authentication, authorization and information gathering.
trans-unit.target: In addition, ATA leverages a proprietary network parsing engine to capture and parse network traffic of multiple protocols (such as Kerberos, DNS, RPC, NTLM and others) for authentication, authorization and information gathering.

trans-unit.source: This information is collected by ATA via:
trans-unit.target: This information is collected by ATA via:

trans-unit.source: Port mirroring from Domain Controllers and DNS servers to the ATA Gateway
trans-unit.target: Port mirroring from Domain Controllers and DNS servers to the ATA Gateway

trans-unit.source: Deploying an ATA Lightweight Gateway (LGW) directly on Domain Controllers
trans-unit.target: Deploying an ATA Lightweight Gateway (LGW) directly on Domain Controllers

trans-unit.source: For more information on ATA architecture see [ATA Architecture](/advanced-threat-analytics/plan-design/ata-architecture).
trans-unit.target: For more information on ATA architecture see [ATA Architecture](/advanced-threat-analytics/plan-design/ata-architecture).

trans-unit.source: Check out our ATA introductory video!
trans-unit.target: Check out our ATA introductory video!

trans-unit.source: ATA technology detects multiple suspicious activities, focusing on several phases of the cyber-attack kill chain including:
trans-unit.target: ATA technology detects multiple suspicious activities, focusing on several phases of the cyber-attack kill chain including:

trans-unit.source: Reconnaissance, during which attackers are gathering information on how the environment is built, what are the different assets and entities which exist and are generally building their plan for the next phases of the attack.
trans-unit.target: Reconnaissance, during which attackers are gathering information on how the environment is built, what are the different assets and entities which exist and are generally building their plan for the next phases of the attack.

trans-unit.source: Lateral movement cycle, during which an attacker invests time and effort in spreading their attack surface inside your network.
trans-unit.target: Lateral movement cycle, during which an attacker invests time and effort in spreading their attack surface inside your network.

trans-unit.source: Domain dominance (persistence), during which an attacker captures the information allowing them to resume their campaign using various set of entry points, credentials and techniques.
trans-unit.target: Domain dominance (persistence), during which an attacker captures the information allowing them to resume their campaign using various set of entry points, credentials and techniques.

trans-unit.source: These phases of a cyber attack are similar and predictable, no matter what type of company is under attack or what type of information is being targeted.
trans-unit.target: These phases of a cyber attack are similar and predictable, no matter what type of company is under attack or what type of information is being targeted.

trans-unit.source: ATA searches for three main types of attacks: Malicious attacks, abnormal behavior and security issues and risks.
trans-unit.target: ATA searches for three main types of attacks: Malicious attacks, abnormal behavior and security issues and risks.

trans-unit.source: **Malicious attacks** are detected deterministically, by looking for the full list of known attack types including:
trans-unit.target: **Malicious attacks** are detected deterministically, by looking for the full list of known attack types including:

trans-unit.source: For a complete list of the detections and their descriptions please see [What Suspicious Activities Can ATA detect?](ata-threats.md)
trans-unit.target: For a complete list of the detections and their descriptions please see [What Suspicious Activities Can ATA detect?](ata-threats.md)

trans-unit.source: ATA detects these suspicious activities and surfaces the information in the ATA Console including a clear view of Who, What, When and How.
trans-unit.target: ATA detects these suspicious activities and surfaces the information in the ATA Console including a clear view of Who, What, When and How.

trans-unit.source: As you can see, by monitoring this simple, user-friendly dashboard, you are alerted that ATA suspects that a Pass-the-Hash attack was attempted on Client 1 and Client 2 computers in your network.
trans-unit.target: As you can see, by monitoring this simple, user-friendly dashboard, you are alerted that ATA suspects that a Pass-the-Hash attack was attempted on Client 1 and Client 2 computers in your network.

trans-unit.source: **Abnormal behavior** is detected by ATA using behavioral analytics and leveraging Machine Learning to uncover questionable activities and abnormal behavior in users and devices in your network, including:
trans-unit.target: **Abnormal behavior** is detected by ATA using behavioral analytics and leveraging Machine Learning to uncover questionable activities and abnormal behavior in users and devices in your network, including:

trans-unit.source: You can view suspicious activities of this type in the ATA Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: You can view suspicious activities of this type in the ATA Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, ATA alerts you when a user accesses 4 computers that are not ordinarily accessed by this user, which could be a cause for alarm.
trans-unit.target: In the following example, ATA alerts you when a user accesses 4 computers that are not ordinarily accessed by this user, which could be a cause for alarm.

trans-unit.source: ATA also detects **security issues and risks**, including:
trans-unit.target: ATA also detects **security issues and risks**, including:

trans-unit.source: You can view suspicious activities of this type in the ATA Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: You can view suspicious activities of this type in the ATA Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, ATA is letting you know that there is a broken trust relationship between a computer in your network and the domain.
trans-unit.target: In the following example, ATA is letting you know that there is a broken trust relationship between a computer in your network and the domain.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how ATA fits into your network: [ATA architecture](/advanced-threat-analytics/plan-design/ata-architecture)
trans-unit.target: For more information about how ATA fits into your network: [ATA architecture](/advanced-threat-analytics/plan-design/ata-architecture)
